greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Absolute difference table of the divisors of the positive integers.
comment: This is an irregular tetrahedron T(n,j,k) read by rows in which the slice n lists the elements of the rows of the absolute difference triangle of the divisors of n (including the divisors of n).
The first row of the slice n is also the n-th row of the triangle A027750.
The bottom entry of the slice n is A187203(n).
The sum of the elements of the slice n is A187215(n).
For another version see A273102 from which differs at a(92).
example: For n = 18 the divisors of 18 are 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18, so the absolute difference triangle of the divisors of 18 is
This is also an irregular triangle T(n,r) read by rows in which row n lists the absolute difference triangle of the divisors of n flattened.
Row lengths are the terms of A184389. Row sums give A187215.
mathematica: Table[Drop[FixedPointList[Abs@ Differences@ # &, Divisors@ n], -2], {n, 15}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 16 2016 *)
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, May 15 2016
